I'd say 10^6 tests have to be run.

> > I'm afraid I won't be able to add test indefinitively like that (I juste
> > had a Exception in thread "main" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError, and
> > wondered if any of you had any suggestions on how to organise tests.
> 
> Is there an infinite recursion somewhere?

Not that I think, as it is iterating over the records
(session.iterate("from Customer") and each record is undergoing really
simple tests. I'm still tweaking the mappings so it could be the problem
is there

[zip]

> So you are storing test data in a database? Interesting. How many 
> records? Do you really need to test every record? or just a 
> representative set of records? What if there are 1000 records that all 
> test the same essential code path?

I am testing the migration of _data_ from one database to another. Maybe
I wasn't clear on that point.
For example, I want to check that customers in the new schema are still related to
the same orders as in the old schema. 

I want to check every record for several reasons:
-once the test is written, it's the same to apply it to all records or
to selected records (hibernate iteration)
-I already have found a minor problem occuring with 3 records out of
85000
-I want to be sure the data transposition is really as expected :-)


My question about the organisation of the tests is that I feel like all
tests are first added to the suite, and are run only after all tests
have been added. Am I wrong on that? If it runs as I said, adding all
10^6 tests to test the whole database could be the reason of an out of
memory problem (all objects to be tested would be in memory, which means
the whole db would be loaded in memory). It's just a guess, just trying
to understand (I could be completely wrong actually ;-)

Raph
